definition: to die/to depart from the world forever
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: It was a pity that his sea power kingdom was not complete then he passed away.
sentences.chinese: 可惜他的海权王国并未完成，便与世长辞了。

sentences.english: But at this moment came on the death of his father passed away.
sentences.chinese: 然而就在这一刻传来了他父亲与世长辞的噩耗。

sentences.english: The whole world was convulsed over the passing away of the great man.
sentences.chinese: 这位伟人与世长辞，全世界为之震动。

sentences.english: And the next night he died.
sentences.chinese: 第三天夜里便与世长辞。

sentences.english: Regardless, the dream of fuel cell-powered vehicles just won't die.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，燃料电池驱动汽车的梦想仍不会与世长辞。

sentences.english: Yes, the King of Pop is dead as well.
sentences.chinese: 是的，这位流行天王也不幸与世长辞了。

definition: to live to the (ripe) age of
to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
lit. to fly on a crane to the Western Paradise/fig. to pass away (idiom)
to die/to depart this mortal coil
to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
see 駕鶴西去|驾鹤西去[jia4 he4 xi1 qu4]
see 駕鶴西去|驾鹤西去[jia4 he4 xi1 qu4]
to die an untimely death (idiom)/to be cut off in one's prime
